Description: Ostracon, large section (four fragments joined and another detached) of the upper-body of a light-brown pottery wine-jar with tear-shaped body, cylindrical neck and one handle surviving, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and faint traces of two lines of black-painted hieratic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393532) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393532)
Condition: fair (incomplete - five fragments - four joined together)
